author: RedacciÃ³n AN / ES
title: Video | Intentan impedir mostrar vestido con el rostro de Jesucristo a actriz en Cannes | Aristegui Noticias
text: Video | Intentan impedir mostrar vestido con el rostro de Jesucristo a actriz en Cannes "Esta es la primera vez en 77 aÃ±os de el gran festival de Cannes que se exhibe a JesÃºs en este escenario", celebrÃ³ Massiel Taveras. - RedacciÃ³n AN / ES La actriz y modelo dominicana Massiel Taveras luciÃ³ una gran capa con la imagen pintada de Jesucristo en el Festival de Cannes, la cual intentaron evitar que fuera exhibida. A travÃ©s de Instagram Massiel Taveras mostrÃ³ fotografÃ­as de ella con el vestido que culminaba con la capa, la cual fue realizada por dominicanos. El rostro de Jesucristo con espinas en la capa fue diseÃ±o de Giannina Azar y plasmado por el pintor Yan PÃ¡ez, ambos de RepÃºblica Dominicana. La obra de arte bautizada como â€œEl Cristoâ€ luciÃ³ por la alfombra roja del Festival de Cannes; sin embargo, un par de personas -posiblemente seguridad del evento- intentÃ³ tapar la imagen religiosa. En redes sociales se viralizÃ³ el video en el que los detractores querÃ­an impedir que luciera â€œEl Cristoâ€. Te podrÃ­a interesar > [Karla SofÃ­a GascÃ³n, primera actriz trans en ganar premio a Mejor Actriz en Cannes](https://aristeguinoticias.com/2505/kiosko/karla-sofia-gascon-primera-actriz-trans-en-ganar-premio-a-mejor-actriz-en-cannes/) Massiel Taveras celebrÃ³ en su cuenta de Instagram que finalmente se permitiera lucir la capa. â€œEsta es la primera vez en 77 aÃ±os de el gran festival de Cannes que se exhibe a JesÃºs en este escenarioâ€. Asimismo agradeciÃ³ el trabajo de sus connacionales dominicanos Giannina Azar y Yan PÃ¡ez por lograr este trabajo artÃ­stico. La tambiÃ©n productora Taveras compartiÃ³ un escrito en su cuenta de Instagram, en el que se detalla que la capa mide 15 pies de largo (unos 4 metros con 57 centÃ­metros). Si bien no se determinÃ³ el valor econÃ³mico de la prenda, en el escrito compartido por Massiel Taveras se menciona que pudiera ser vendido en hasta 450 mil dÃ³lares.

author: Reinette LeJeune
title: Aqara HomeKit smart lock U100 with fingerprint sensor and Apple Home key returns to $133 low
text:
Aqara Smart Lock U100 for $132.99 shipped . Down from its $230 price tag, it has only seen a few previous discounts since its release back during the summer, with Black Friday sales dropping costs down to the lowest prices we have tracked. Todayâ€™s deal comes in as a 42% markdown off the going rate, giving you $97 in savings ($7 more than our previous mention) and marking a return to the all-time low from Thanksgiving weekend sales. Over the summer, we were quite impressed with this new smart lock, which you can read about in our hands-on review , or head below the fold to learn more.
The U100 smart lock comes fully integrated into Apple Home, sporting a touchscreen keypad and fingerprint sensor that allows for easier access to your home. It also offers access via Apple Home keys by simply tapping your iPhone or Apple Watch to the door â€“ even when itâ€™s out of power. The high-precision fingerprint sensor is able to save up to 50 different fingerprints and numeral passwords are easily reconfigured through the Aqara Home app, even allowing for one-time passwords for visitors, as well as a mechanical key for emergencies. It features an auto-lock function that utilizes the built-in gyroscope to lock the door anytime immediately after closing it, as well as a â€œdo not disturbâ€ mode to silence its actions for when you return home late. It also comes fully compatible with third-party ecosystems like Google Home, Alexa, and IFTTT.
If youâ€™ve wanted more atmospheric lighting in your home, check out our recent coverage of the Govee Smart Light Bulb 2-pack that is currently on sale at its lowest price we have tracked. They offer the usual smart features like scheduling, timers, group controls, music syncing, and RGBWW action that gives you 16 million DIY colors and 54 pre-set scene modes. You can also head on over to our smart home hub to stay up-to-date on the very best deals on all the gear and gadgets that are sure to bring your home further into the twenty-first century.
Aqara Smart Lock U100 features: ã€Fingerprint and More Ways to Unlockã€‘The Smart Lock U100 offers multiple ways to unlock, including a high-precision fingerprint reader for up to 50 fingerprints, remotely configurable passwords via the Aqara Home app (An Aqara Zigbee 3.0 hub is required), one-time local passwords for visitors, and a mechanical key for emergency use. * The NFC card is not included and is sold separately. ã€Automations with Aqara and Third-Party Devicesã€‘With an Aqara Zigbee 3.0 hub, the Smart Door Lock U100 is compatible with third-party ecosystems like Google Home, Alexa, IFTTT as well as the Aqara Home app, allowing it to be easily integrated into a wide range of smart home setups and used in smart home automations. For example, when someone presses the Aqara Video Doorbell G4, you will be able to view who is at your door and easily unlock the U100. ã€A Durable and Secure Biometric door Lock with Long Battery Lifeã€‘ The U100 is powered by 4 AA 1.5V batteries (included) and has a long battery life of up to 8 months. Also, a USB-C port for emergency charging is available. The lock body made of zinc alloy has an IP65 rating and complies with the same safety standard as BHMA Level 3. Itâ€™s capable of withstanding temperatures ranging from -31Â°F to 151Â°F. Your sensitive data (e.g., fingerprints) is stored locally and fully AES encrypted.

author: VNExplorer
title: Boston firefighter who rescued three-year-old boy from a house fire in 1978 reunites with him 45 years later
text:
A Boston firefighter reunited with a now grown-up man that he rescued from a house fire 45 years ago Joe Gilmore rescued three-year-old Umar Fox and his sister Lisa from the burning building in 1978 The children's mother Silvia also attended the reunion to express her gratitude for saving their lives
A Boston firefighter enjoyed an emotional reunion with a man he saved from a house fire 45 years ago, when the latter was just a baby.
An emotional black and white image showed the incredible moment Joe Gilmore clutched two young children in his arms as he hauled them out of a burning building.
The firefighter, who was 33 at the time, was captured gritting his teeth as he heroically rescued the three-year-old boy and nine-year-old girl from the blaze that had begun in their three-story Dorchester house.
The children, siblings Lisa and Umar Fox, were visibly distressed and shocked in the image shot by George Rizer.
In a touching development, the three-year-old boy â€“ who is now a 48-year-old man, met the hero that saved his life back in 1978 on Wednesday to express his gratitude.
A Boston firefighter reunited with the now-adult baby he rescued from a house fire 45 years ago
An emotional black and white image showed the incredible moment Joe Gilmore clutched two young children in his arms as he hauled them out of a burning building
Umar Fox and his mother Silvia Fox, 70, met Gilmore at Dorchesterâ€™s Florian Hall clutching a bunch of balloons bearing the message â€˜thank youâ€™.
â€˜Oh my god, you saved my kids,â€™ Mrs. Fox told Gilmore as she met him for the first time, the Boston Globe reported.
â€˜Iâ€™ve been waiting 45 years to say thank you,â€™ the grateful mother said as tears welled up in her eyes.
â€˜Little Umar isnâ€™t so little anymore,â€™ Gilmore said as he approached Umar Fox â€“ who was all smiles and laughter as he entered the hall.
Lisa Fox had been unable to attend the heartfelt reunion due to an illness.
Gilmore admitted that he had remembered the 1978 rescue, but didnâ€™t think it was anything noteworthy because that was just the nature of his job.
But to Mrs. Fox â€“ his act of service meant the world.
The single mother had been caring for other children at the day car center where she worked when the fire struck.
Her own children were home from school for a holiday break during the catastrophe.
Umar Fox is now a father of three and a stepdad to two others. He works as a school bus driver and transports over 65 kids and teenagers to school every day.
He had heard stories about the miraculous rescue throughout his life, but was desperate to find his lifesaver and thank him â€“ and he was eventually able to track Gilmore down on social media.
During their touching meet-up â€“ the trio playfully attempted to re-create the iconic photograph, with a now much larger Fox standing on a chair with his arms around Gilmore.
Fox joked that the picture captured his two favorite things â€“ his harmonica, which he was clutching, and not wearing pants.
â€˜Oh my god, you saved my kids,â€™ Mrs. Fox told Gilmore as she met him for the first time
During their touching meet-up â€“ the trio playfully attempted to re-create the iconic photograph, with a now much larger Fox standing on a chair with his arms around Gilmore
Fox opened up about his own lifesaving acts throughout his life â€“ telling Gilmore that he saved a child from drowning when he was a teenager and managed to talk two people out of suicide while working as a recovery coach
â€˜Forty-five years after this incident, who would think we will all still be here to be able to talk about it?â€™ Gilmore said.
Fox opened up about his own lifesaving acts throughout his life â€“ telling Gilmore that he saved a child from drowning when he was a teenager and managed to talk two people out of suicide while working as a recovery coach.
â€˜What you did, in turn, saved other peopleâ€™s lives and brought more into the world,â€™ Fox said
â€˜You didnâ€™t just do your job,â€™ Silvia Fox told Gilmore as they prepared to leave, â€˜You did it well.â€™
The Fox family also invited the photographer Rizer to join in on their reunion.
Rizer had captured the incredible picture after he had been photographing a fire in Chinatown earlier that day.
He shot many fires and disasters over his career as a photographer â€“ and explained that anytime he managed to capture a dramatic rescue it was down to â€˜pure serendipityâ€™.
â€˜The worst thing you can hear on the police scanner or fire scanner on the way to any event is, â€œchildren trapped,â€â€˜ he said.
â€˜If I spent four minutes at that fire, itâ€™d be a miracle,â€™ Rizer said, adding that he shot less than one roll of 35mm film during the disaster.
â€˜Joe did the heavy lifting â€” pun intended,â€™ Rizer said of Gilmore. â€˜Media people, we just capture history, we donâ€™t make it.â€™

author: Natasha Decker
title: Top 10 Atlanta Food Influencers To Have On Your Timelines
text:
Atlanta food influencers are insiders into the cityâ€™s best eats and food experiences. Whether youâ€™re looking for casual fare, fine dining, scrumptious takeaway plates, or foodie events, the content creators below offer a bevy of videos and information sure to intrigue and satisfy your palate.
Getting your Atlanta food scene itinerary ready ahead of Blavity Fest 2025 is a must. The two-day celebration of Black brands, culture, and creativity is happening in Atlanta from May 31 through June 1. Itâ€™ll be a time to network with other movers and shakers, explore Atlantaâ€™s vibrant Black food scene, vibe out at Blavity House Party, prioritize wellness during Summit 21, and so much more. You can purchase tickets to Blavity Fest here.
Discover these 10 Atlanta food influencers you should have on your radar in 2025.
Teiry C. â€“ @TongueTiedFoodie
This budding food content creator is sure to blow up even more with her fun and dynamic posts of Atlantaâ€™s best restaurants. In addition to showing delicious meals and drinks across the city, Tiery shares unique foodie experiences. For example, an early December post showed her enjoying a Secret Supper seated dinner in the â€œmiddle of nowhereâ€ with several other guests. Sheâ€™s also shared about a monthly cocktail-making class that ATLiens can enjoy. On the @TongueTiedFoodie page, youâ€™ll find straightforward clips of drinks and good eats you can make at home.
Justin Brown â€“ @TheRealFoodStalker
Justinâ€™s food-related videos include restaurant recaps and taste tests. His footage captures him dining in his car on fresh hot food or eating inside one of Atlantaâ€™s many restaurants. His approachable and easygoing content is high quality, yet no frills and fuss. Itâ€™s a great page for getting the low down on whatâ€™s enjoyable to the tastebuds and worth your money. His content creation is fueled by his love of how food brings people together.
Ikela Braggs â€“ @Food_SOB
Ikela shares some of Atlantaâ€™s premier dining spots, and her page is filled with delicious eats. She often shares ticketed events that her followers can attend and discount codes so others can experience Atlantaâ€™s food scene in unique ways. Also, check out her page to enter giveaways for event tickets and restaurant gift cards.
Nikka Shae â€“ @OhNikka
Nikka is perfect to follow for lifestyle content mixed in with clips capturing Atlantaâ€™s food scene. Her page is ideal for finding brunch spots or classy cocktail bars. Thereâ€™s a fun yet sophisticated vibe that showcases the best food establishments for soft life seekers. Youâ€™ll also find hotel and lifestyle long-form content on her socials and blog.
Julian M. Glascoe aka Mr. Bleu Cheese â€“ @AtlantaFoodGuy
This content creator is one of Atlantaâ€™s most popular, based on his over 198,000 Instagram followers and 100,000 on TikTok. His content shares both savory and sweet eats throughout the Atlanta metro area. Prepare for content featuring lots of soul and cajun food, brunch spots, and must-try places for takeaway plates. He also often features halal and vegan restaurants in Atlanta.
Angie â€“ @GourmetAngiie
Angie describes herself as a private chef and personal taster. Check her page for some of Atlantaâ€™s most delicious soul food, cajun, and creole-flavored eats. Sheâ€™s tapped into the celebrity scene, whether dining at their restaurants, cooking for them, or otherwise featuring them in her content. Youâ€™ll see Bow Wow, Quavo, Saucy Santana, Waka Flocka Flame, Tokyo Toni, and more as you scroll her page.
Erica A. Thomas â€“ @EatingWithErica
If youâ€™re based in Georgiaâ€™s capital, you may have seen Erica on Fox 5 Atlanta as a contributor sharing light bites, recipes, places to eat, and hosting tips. A wife and mother, sheâ€™s also the proud founder of the Eating with Erica Supper Club, a womens-only â€œpart dinner party, part social soirÃ©e.â€
Skylar Currie â€“ @ServingLooksATL
This foodie shares restaurants, food and drink-related pop-ups, and more. Her content includes all types of cuisines, including Thai, Korean, American, Latin, Southern, and Japanese. Skylarâ€™s page is ideal for scoping out lunch and dinner spots. Her clips mostly include well-portioned savory and moreish-looking meals.
Joy Westinghouse â€“ @EatsWJoy
Joyâ€™s page is where to go for yummy cocktails and casual bites like tacos, gourmet hot dogs, ice cream, and burgers. She also shares some great places for larger portioned seated meals, like brunch, lunch, and dinner. The spots she features are fun and perfect for noshing on good eats during a solo date or night out with friends.
Meka Dorsey @Miss_Mekad
[@miss_mekad]10 Shots + 12 Tacos = $25/person | Let me show you how Follow @miss_mekad for more deals in Atlanta â€¼ï¸ ðŸ“ @rrealtacos If you bring 3 of your friends with you for Taco Tuesday or any random night, you can get 10 shots and 12 tacos for only $25 a person if you split the cost. Each person will get 2.5 shots and 3 tacos a piece. Taco bout a good deal ðŸ˜‰ðŸ¤£ . . . Atlanta Cinco de Mayo. Cinco de Mayo weekend. Fun Things to do in Atlanta. Atlanta things to do. Date Night Atlanta. Date ideas in Atlanta. Atlanta date night. Atlanta things to do. Places to eat in Atlanta. Restaurants in Atlanta. Atlanta Brunch. Brunch in Atlanta. Atlanta Date Night Ideas. Happy hour in Atlanta. Atlanta happy hour. Atlanta Content Creator. Atlanta Influencer. Atlanta Blogger. Content Creator. UGC creator. Blogger. Mini vlog. Lifestyle Content Creator. Atlanta Brunch. Atlanta Happy Hour. Food vlogs. Black Content Creator. At Home Date Night Ideas. DIY. Home date night. Home date ideas. Romantic night at home. Events in Atlanta. Black business owner. Women owned business. Atlanta creator. Black love. Amazon finds. Amazon home finds. Amazon fashion. Date night outfit. Date night at home. Date night ideas. Romantic date night Atlanta. Competitive date night Atlanta. Atlanta brunch spots. Atlanta nightlife. Atlanta Georgia. â€“[#atlantainfluencer][#contentcreator][#atlantacontentcreator][#atlantadatenight][#atlantabrunch][#lifestylevlog][#lifestylecontent][#explorepage][#atlantahappyhour][#eventsinatlanta][#blackcreator][#atlantadatenight][#thingstodoinatlanta][#influencer][#atlantablogger][#blogger][â™¬ OKAY JT â€“ renny]
Meka is a lifestyle influencer who shares some of Atlantaâ€™s finest food fare. Many of the places she features are great date night suggestions. Her more detailed videos and captions include food shots, meal pricing, and the 411 on what she taste tested, making her page a one-stop shop.

author: Vatican News
title: Christmas 2023: Christâ€™s vulnerable heart can bring peace to all - Vatican News
text: Christmas 2023: Christâ€™s vulnerable heart can bring peace to all Christmas Message of Bishop William McGrattan Bishop of Calgary and President of the Canadian Conference of Catholic Bishops Dear Sisters and Brothers in Christ, The birth of Jesus into human history was the fulfilment of the hopes and longings, dreams, and desires of the people of ancient Israel. Lukeâ€™s version of the Nativity of the Lord is Maryâ€™s Nativity of joy. We know the story so well, but we often forget what lies at the heart of its very simple message. It is a story of poverty and simplicity, excitement and surprises, sadness and joy; a story of military occupation and oppression, a light in the darkness. Luke's message is clear: no event in our shadow-filled history of the world is alien to the coming of the Savior. No power, however violent and oppressive, escapes the reach of God's purposes. Matthewâ€™s story of Jesusâ€™ origins is about the scriptures being fulfilled in the child born in Bethlehem. In Matthew 1:23 we have the evocative word â€œEmmanuelâ€ â€“ â€œGod is with us.â€ In the name â€œEmmanuel,â€ we find the answer to humanityâ€™s deepest longings for God throughout the ages. Emmanuel is both a prayer and plea on our behalf and a promise and declaration on Godâ€™s part. When we pronounce the word, we are really praying and pleading: â€œGod, be with us!â€ And when God speaks it, the Almighty, eternal Creator of the world is telling us: â€œI am with youâ€ in this Child. That first Christmas reminds us of truths of which we can never hear enough. The Gospel stories of Jesusâ€™ birth invite us to become pilgrims and follow shepherds and kings, saints and sinners, and that long procession of witnesses of all generations as they seek the light in the darkness and share their message of good news with a world steeped in darkness. The birth of this child in Bethlehem is extremely powerful as a source of consolation and hope in an age so concerned with the questions of peace, justice, and the future of the human race. The child of Bethlehem is for us "Wonderful Counsellor", deeply concerned with the ultimate good and wholeness of others. His gentle advice to us never leads us into destruction but only into the fullness of life. He is "Mighty God", directing our human history, but also living it with us. He is more powerful than any military force, war or occupation, and yet his force and might are revealed in hearts and eyes meeting. He is "Everlasting Father", teaching us what it means to be constantly present to others, giving life, blessing life, and celebrating life. He is unable to abandon us, as so many human beings are capable of doing. He is "Prince of Peace", the bringer of reconciliation, wholeness, harmony, and completion to the human family. Against the reality of armed conflict beyond our capacity to imagine in many parts of the world, the naming of this child as Prince of Peace is also extremely significant for the survival of the whole human family. Pope Francis has reminded us: â€œâ€¦as we contemplate Jesus, God made man, small, poor, defenceless, we cannot but think of the tragedy that the inhabitants of the Holy Land are living, expressing to those brothers and sisters of ours, especially the children and their parents, our closeness and our spiritual support. They are the ones who pay the true price of war.â€ If we allow the Christ child to truly dwell within us this year, then we shall know that in the midst of our own deep darkness and fears, from a crib in Bethlehem and a cross in Jerusalem, God's vulnerable heart can bring light, healing, wonderment, salvation, and peace to each of us, and to the whole world. On behalf of the Bishops of Canada and the Church in our vast land from sea to sea to sea, I wish you a blessed, joyful, and peaceful Christmas.

organizations.name: canadian conference of catholic bishops dear sisters and brothers in christ

title: #10 El Parque Nacional de Ordesa confirma la destrucciÃ³n de 12 clavijas de Cotatuero

author: Glory Kaburu
title: Crypto Boom: 3 Coins That May 2x in the Coming Weeks
text:
- Bitcoin, Ripple, and Solana show strong signs of growth, with the potential to double in value amid improving market signals.
- Solana upgrade and ETF hopes for XRP boost investor optimism as BTC eyes key technical breakouts above resistance.
The cryptocurrency market has faced significant volatility recently. Bitcoin (BTC) fell to $81,100 after climbing to $88,000.The global crypto market cap also dropped from $3 trillion to $2.8 trillion in March.
Ethereum (ETH) also maintained a slight edge over Bitcoin, trading at $1,876 as of Wednesday. However, these three cryptocurrencies are now positioned for a possible 2x move in the coming weeks.
1. Bitcoin (BTC): Is a Breakout Rally on the Horizon?
Bitcoin has seen a 22.7% drop from its all-time high of $108,786, yet market sentiment remains cautiously optimistic. According to ETHNews, some analysts predict a long-term rise to $150,000, with even higher targets like a $100 trillion market cap for the crypto.
On Wednesday, Bitcoin remained mostly flat as markets awaited U.S. President Donald Trumpâ€™s tariff announcement. The event, set for April 2 at 4 p.m. Eastern Time, has been dubbed â€œLiberation Dayâ€ by the White House. The expected announcement has caused unease across global markets, with European stocks trending lower and Wall Street firms bracing for volatility, according to Bloomberg.
â€” The White House (@WhiteHouse)
[March 25, 2025]
Earlier this week, Bitcoin briefly touched $85,000 before dipping to $81,188, later rebounding and gaining 3.19% in 24 hours. This price movement, while volatile, has highlighted the bullsâ€™ defense of key support levels.
Ali Martinez, a well-known crypto analyst, noted that BTC is approaching two critical moving averages. A breakout above the 200-day MA at $86,200 and the 50-day MA at $88,300 could signal renewed bullish momentum.
Meanwhile, large holders have been accumulating BTC. Transfers from retail wallets to long-term custodians suggest growing confidence in holding rather than selling.
Moreover, on-chain data has offered some reassurance. Bitcoinâ€™s hashrate recently hit a new all-time high, signaling that miners remain committed and confident in the networkâ€™s future
2. Ripple (XRP): The Crypto Poised for a Rally
Rippleâ€™s XRP is gaining attention as one of the top crypto with strong growth potential in the coming months. As discussed by ETHNews, following the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) dropping its lawsuit against Ripple, market sentiment turned positive
Analysts are also watching the possibility of an XRP exchange-traded fund (ETF). The odds for a spot ETF approval on Polymarket hit 85% this week, boosting optimism among traders. Multiple analysts have echoed this projection, fueling a renewed bullish outlook.
XRPâ€™s price was last seen trading at $2.34, reflecting a slight 0.2% gain in the past 24 hours. Traders believe this consolidation could be the start of a broader rally. One crypto analyst, known as Dark Defender, has given a bullish forecast on X.
Based on wave analysis, the analyst predicts XRPâ€™s third wave will range between $5.85 and $8.076. The fifth wave, expected to follow later, could push prices even higherâ€”possibly between $18.22 and $23.20.
On-chain data shows increased activity among XRP holders as Q1 closes, supporting these projections. Traders are preparing for a possible market-wide recovery, and many expect XRP to lead the altcoin sector.
3. Solana (SOL): A Strong Contender for Growth
Solana (SOL) has shown strong signs of recovery despite past setbacks. After reaching an all-time high of $293.31, SOL dropped over 57%, especially after the FTX collapse in 2022. The coin fell below $10 but has bounced back, showing resilience in recent months.
In the past 24 hours, Solanaâ€™s stablecoin supply jumped by $106.8 million. This signals rising investor interest and potential new capital flowing into the ecosystem. On-chain data shows over $100 million in SOL was bought in the last five days, with a major $89 million transaction on March 28.
At the same time, Solanaâ€™s network activity is growing, according to Artemis data. Between March 24 and now, the number of daily transactions rose from 87.6 million to 92.7 million, showing strong user engagement.
In a recent update, we covered, a proposed network upgrade is also gaining attention. The community is considering raising the per-block capacity from 48 million to 60 million compute units (CUs). If approved, this upgrade could boost scalability and potentially drive a 150% price surge in Q2 2025, with a breakout toward the $300 level.
